# Testes de Hipóteses

## Importar planilha de dados diversos


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_3e0f6a6b497c8042e14dc6a76988e978'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(gsheet)
mg <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=983033137")
```
:::


## Vizualizar


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_ad6308d5bb6b81a3be963702a1c96551'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.0     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggthemes)


mg |> 
  ggplot(aes(trat, comp))+
  geom_boxplot(fill = "gray")+
  theme_few()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Teste t para dois grupos de médias independentes


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_e5c9442c78dc6d002414eae6ebcc92dd'}

```{.r .cell-code}
#Passar os dados para o formato largo
mg2 <- mg |> 
  pivot_wider(names_from = trat, values_from = comp)
 
mg2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 3
     rep   Mg2 control
   <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>
 1     1   9      13.7
 2     2  12.5    15.9
 3     3  10      15.7
 4     4   8      14.2
 5     5  13.2    15.9
 6     6  11      16.5
 7     7  10.8    18  
 8     8   9.5    14.4
 9     9  10.8    16.4
10    10  10.4    16  
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Presupposes: normality and homogeneity of variance

shapiro.test(mg2$control) #No teste de shapiro a H0 é de que a distribuição é normal
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  mg2$control
W = 0.93886, p-value = 0.5404
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(mg2$control)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(mg2$Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  mg2$Mg2
W = 0.97269, p-value = 0.9146
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(mg2$Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
var.test(mg2$control, mg2$Mg2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	F test to compare two variances

data:  mg2$control and mg2$Mg2
F = 0.67654, num df = 9, denom df = 9, p-value = 0.5698
alternative hypothesis: true ratio of variances is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.1680428 2.7237436
sample estimates:
ratio of variances 
         0.6765394 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(mg2$control)
qqline(mg2$control)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#T test
teste1 <- t.test(mg2$control, mg2$Mg2) #Pode usar 'var.equal = FALSE' quando a variância for heterogênea
```
:::


## Reportar o resultado


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_96980c8dda747a6473a3128c4f065639'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(report)
report(teste1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: Function `format_text()` is deprecated and will be removed in a future
  release. Please use `text_format()` instead.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Effect sizes were labelled following Cohen's (1988) recommendations.

The Welch Two Sample t-test testing the difference between mg2$control and
mg2$Mg2 (mean of x = 15.68, mean of y = 10.52) suggests that the effect is
positive, statistically significant, and large (difference = 5.16, 95% CI
[3.83, 6.49], t(17.35) = 8.15, p < .001; Cohen's d = 3.65, 95% CI [2.14, 5.12])
```
:::
:::


## Teste t para dois grupos de médias dependentes


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_0602fd3a7ccbc221cbc803301044df56'}

```{.r .cell-code}
escala <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=1729131173")

#Vizualizar
escala |> 
  ggplot(aes(assessment, acuracia))+
  geom_boxplot(fill = "gray")+
  theme_few()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Passar os dados para o formato largo
escala2 <- escala |> 
  select(assessment, rater, acuracia) |> 
  pivot_wider(names_from = assessment, values_from = acuracia)


 escala2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 3
   rater Unaided Aided1
   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>
 1 A        0.81   0.91
 2 B        0.72   0.91
 3 C        0.4    0.91
 4 D        0.82   0.96
 5 E        0.75   0.96
 6 F        0.45   0.9 
 7 G        0.81   0.85
 8 H        0.78   0.88
 9 I        0.78   0.95
10 J        0.5    0.94
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Presupposes: normality and homogeneity of variance

shapiro.test(escala2$Unaided) #No teste de shapiro a H0 é de que a distribuição é normal
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  escala2$Unaided
W = 0.7748, p-value = 0.007155
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(escala2$Unaided)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(escala2$Unaided)
qqline(escala2$Unaided)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(escala2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  escala2$Aided1
W = 0.92852, p-value = 0.4335
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(escala2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-4.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(escala2$Aided1)
qqline(escala2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-5.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Homogeneidade de variância
var.test(escala2$Unaided, escala2$Aided1) #Ho é que a variância é homogênea
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	F test to compare two variances

data:  escala2$Unaided and escala2$Aided1
F = 20.978, num df = 9, denom df = 9, p-value = 0.000106
alternative hypothesis: true ratio of variances is not equal to 1
95 percent confidence interval:
  5.210754 84.459185
sample estimates:
ratio of variances 
          20.97847 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#T test
teste2 <- t.test(escala2$Unaided, escala2$Aided1,
                 paired = TRUE,
                 var.equal = FALSE) #Usar 'paired = TRUE' quando o teste t for pareado (média dependentes) e 'var.equal = FALSE' quando a variância for heterogêneanea

teste2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Paired t-test

data:  escala2$Unaided and escala2$Aided1
t = -4.4214, df = 9, p-value = 0.001668
alternative hypothesis: true mean difference is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -0.3552353 -0.1147647
sample estimates:
mean difference 
         -0.235 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
report(teste2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning: Function `format_text()` is deprecated and will be removed in a future
  release. Please use `text_format()` instead.
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Effect sizes were labelled following Cohen's (1988) recommendations.

The Paired t-test testing the difference between escala2$Unaided and
escala2$Aided1 (mean difference = -0.23) suggests that the effect is negative,
statistically significant, and large (difference = -0.23, 95% CI [-0.36,
-0.11], t(9) = -4.42, p = 0.002; Cohen's d = -1.40, 95% CI [-2.27, -0.49])
```
:::
:::


## Teste T não paramétrico


::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_ca4ec4564ee7cab509ba52332adc21c4'}

```{.r .cell-code}
escala_np <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=1729131173")

#Vizualizar
escala_np |> 
  ggplot(aes(assessment, acuracia))+
  geom_boxplot(fill = "gray")+
  theme_few()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Passar os dados para o formato largo
escala_np2 <- escala_np |> 
  select (assessment, rater, acuracia) |> 
  pivot_wider(names_from = assessment, values_from = acuracia)
 
escala_np2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 10 × 3
   rater Unaided Aided1
   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>
 1 A        0.81   0.91
 2 B        0.72   0.91
 3 C        0.4    0.91
 4 D        0.82   0.96
 5 E        0.75   0.96
 6 F        0.45   0.9 
 7 G        0.81   0.85
 8 H        0.78   0.88
 9 I        0.78   0.95
10 J        0.5    0.94
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Presupposes: normality and homogeneity of variance

shapiro.test(escala_np2$Unaided) #No teste de shapiro a H0 é de que a distribuição é normal
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  escala_np2$Unaided
W = 0.7748, p-value = 0.007155
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(escala_np2$Unaided)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-2.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(escala_np2$Unaided)
qqline(escala_np2$Unaided)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-3.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
shapiro.test(escala_np2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Shapiro-Wilk normality test

data:  escala_np2$Aided1
W = 0.92852, p-value = 0.4335
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(escala_np2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-4.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
qqnorm(escala_np2$Aided1)
qqline(escala_np2$Aided1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-5.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#Equivalente ao teste t não paramétrico = teste wilcox
teste3 <- wilcox.test(escala_np2$Unaided, escala_np2$Aided1, paired = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Warning in wilcox.test.default(escala_np2$Unaided, escala_np2$Aided1, paired =
TRUE): não é possível computar o valor de p exato com o de desempate
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
teste3
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Wilcoxon signed rank test with continuity correction

data:  escala_np2$Unaided and escala_np2$Aided1
V = 0, p-value = 0.005889
alternative hypothesis: true location shift is not equal to 0
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='Aula_6_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_0407cb2b83a470dbb2db1e77bff1f5a3'}

```{.r .cell-code}
micelial <- gsheet2tbl("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bq2N19DcZdtax2fQW9OHSGMR0X2__Z9T/edit#gid=959387827")

#Vizualizar
micelial |> 
  ggplot(aes(especie, tcm))+
  geom_boxplot(fill = "gray")+
  geom_jitter(width = 0.1, size = 2)+
  theme_few()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula_6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova_micelial <- aov(tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)
 
anova_micelial
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Call:
   aov(formula = tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)

Terms:
                  especie Residuals
Sum of Squares  1.4695800 0.4679167
Deg. of Freedom         4        25

Residual standard error: 0.1368089
Estimated effects may be unbalanced
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(anova_micelial)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value   Pr(>F)    
especie      4 1.4696  0.3674   19.63 2.03e-07 ***
Residuals   25 0.4679  0.0187                     
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova(anova_micelial)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Analysis of Variance Table

Response: tcm
          Df  Sum Sq Mean Sq F value    Pr(>F)    
especie    4 1.46958 0.36739  19.629 2.028e-07 ***
Residuals 25 0.46792 0.01872                      
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
anova_micelial2 <- lm(tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)

anova_micelial2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)

Coefficients:

      1.572       -0.335       -0.250       -0.660       -0.145  
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(anova_micelial2)
```

```

Call:
lm(formula = tcm ~ especie, data = micelial)

Residuals:
     Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
-0.23667 -0.09667  0.01583  0.08833  0.28333 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  1.57167    0.05585  28.140  < 2e-16 ***
especieFaus -0.33500    0.07899  -4.241 0.000266 ***

especieFmer -0.14500    0.07899  -1.836 0.078317 .
```

```{.r .cell-code}

```
